title: Drawing, East Façade, Olana, 1872
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and ink, graphite on paper
dimensions:
37.3 x 55.6 cm (14 11/16 x 21 7/8 in.)
Frame:  50.8 x 2.5 x 66 cm (20 x 1 x 26 in.), approximate
creditline: Lent by Olana State Historic Site
gallery_text: From 1870 to about 1874, Frederic Church designed, built, and decorated the main house at Olana, his estate on the Hudson. For the architecture, he found inspiration from books on Persian architecture including Pascal Coste’s Monuments Modernes de la Perse (1867), which he purchased as library resource material. For the brick-patterned exterior and the beautifully-colored stenciled decoration inside and out, Church consulted sources including Jules Bourgoin’s Les Arts Arabes (1873), also in his collection and displayed nearby.

Drawing, East Façade, Olana, 1872. Brush and watercolor, pen and ink, graphite on paper. 
Lent by Olana State Historic Site. 7.2012.3.
